mdast-util-from-markdown

mdast utility to parse markdown.

Install

npm:

npm install mdast-util-from-markdown

Use

Say we have the following markdown file, example.md:

## Hello, *World*!

And our script, example.js, looks as follows:

var fs = require('fs')
var fromMarkdown = require('mdast-util-from-markdown')

var doc = fs.readFileSync('example.md')

var tree = fromMarkdown(doc)

console.log(tree)

Now, running node example yields (positional info removed for brevity):

{
  type: 'root',
  children: [
    {
      type: 'heading',
      depth: 2,
      children: [
        {type: 'text', value: 'Hello, '},
        {
          type: 'emphasis',
          children: [{type: 'text', value: 'World'}]
        },
        {type: 'text', value: '!'}
      ]
    }
  ]
}

API

fromMarkdown(doc[, encoding][, options])

Parse markdown to a mdast tree.

Parameters
doc

Value to parse (string or Buffer).

encoding

Character encoding to understand doc as when itâ€™s a Buffer (string, default: 'utf8').

options.extensions

Array of syntax extensions (Array.<MicromarkSyntaxExtension>, default: []). Passed to micromark as extensions.

options.mdastExtensions

Array of mdast extensions (Array.<MdastExtension>, default: []).

Returns

Root.

List of extensions

  • syntax-tree/mdast-util-directive â€” parse directives
  • syntax-tree/mdast-util-footnote â€” parse footnotes
  • syntax-tree/mdast-util-frontmatter â€” parse frontmatter (YAML, TOML, more)
  • syntax-tree/mdast-util-gfm â€” parse GFM
  • syntax-tree/mdast-util-gfm-autolink-literal â€” parse GFM autolink literals
  • syntax-tree/mdast-util-gfm-strikethrough â€” parse GFM strikethrough
  • syntax-tree/mdast-util-gfm-table â€” parse GFM tables
  • syntax-tree/mdast-util-gfm-task-list-item â€” parse GFM task list items
  • syntax-tree/mdast-util-math â€” parse math
  • syntax-tree/mdast-util-mdx â€” parse MDX or MDX.js
  • syntax-tree/mdast-util-mdx-expression â€” parse MDX or MDX.js expressions
  • syntax-tree/mdast-util-mdx-jsx â€” parse MDX or MDX.js JSX
  • syntax-tree/mdast-util-mdxjs-esm â€” parse MDX.js ESM

Security

As Markdown is sometimes used for HTML, and improper use of HTML can open you up to a cross-site scripting (XSS) attack, use of mdast-util-from-markdown can also be unsafe. When going to HTML, use this utility in combination with hast-util-sanitize to make the tree safe.

Related

  • micromark/micromark â€” the smallest commonmark-compliant markdown parser that exists
  • remarkjs/remark â€” markdown processor powered by plugins
  • syntax-tree/mdast-util-to-markdown â€” serialize mdast to markdown
